page.title: 10White Hart Inn, Littleton
page.content: The White Hart Inn is the only public house in Littleton which remains today.It was originally a sixteenth century farmhouse and retains many of the features of an inn of bygone days.The White Hart is very much the focal point of social life in the village and among its facilities is a skittle alley.However,its also boasts a fine restaurant which attracts not only the lunchtime businessman but evening diners from further afield.It also has a large attractive garden.One of its claims to fame is that it was the first pub in the world to stock Baileys.
